Did French authorities know cement company Lafarge was funding terrorist groups?
subhead: A French court sought on Thursday to shed light on the persistent suspicion of state complicity in the Lafarge terrorist financing case. Between the proven lie of a Lafarge executive to a diplomat and the timely forgetfulness of an ambassador, the fog has only thickened.

title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in deal of the decade
subhead: The acquisition, which will face regulatory scrutiny by the Trump administration, gives Netflix access to a vast film catalog and the HBO Max streaming service.

title: European Commission fines X €120 million for transparency violations
subhead: Brussels ruled that Elon Musk's social media platform violated three provisions of the European Union's Digital Services Act related to transparency and accountability. It is continuing its investigation into the dissemination of illegal content and misinformation.

title: France's Théâtre du Soleil faces audit following allegations of sexual violence
subhead: The French Ministry of Culture has recommended an independent audit of Ariane Mnouchkine's troupe, which has been shaken by multiple testimonies from former employees and volunteers.

title: 'With 'The American Revolution' series, director Ken Burns warns against the tendency to judge heroes of the past through the eyes of the present'
subhead: In a spectacular documentary, the filmmaker advocates for a nuanced and diverse understanding of the history of the American War of Independence against the British Crown – a perspective that does not sit well with all Republicans, explains Le Monde's Corine Lesnes.

title: Influential study on glyphosate safety retracted 25 years after publication
subhead: A 2000 study that concluded the well-known herbicide glyphosate was safe, widely cited since then, has just been officially disavowed by the journal that published it. The scientists are suspected of having signed a text actually prepared by Monsanto.
